com.github.triceo.splitlog.api

Interface MessageMetric<T extends Number,S extends MessageProducer<S>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the value that the metric is measuring.
    S - Where this is getting its Messages from.
    All Superinterfaces:
    MessageConsumer<S>, MessageListener<S>

    public interface MessageMetric<T extends Number,S extends MessageProducer<S>>
extends MessageConsumer<S>
    Allows users to track various statistics on classes implementing MessageProducer. These classes are intended for measuring only, and will therefore not store the Messages that have passed through them.

    • Method Detail

      • getMeasure

        MessageMeasure<T,S> getMeasure()
        Retrieves the measure that is used to produce the value of this metric.
        Returns:
        Never null.

      • getMessageCount

        long getMessageCount()
        Retrieve the number of times that the metric has been invoked on a Message.
        Returns:
        A number >= 0.

      • getMessageCount

        long getMessageCount(Message timestamp)
        Retrieve the number of times that the metric has been invoked on a Message, at the time immediately after a given message has been processed.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The point in time after this message was processed.
        Returns:
        0 when timestamp is null. -1 in case no such message was ever processed by this metric. The proper value otherwise.

      • getSource

        S getSource()
        Retrieve the instance that is responsible for notifying this metric of new Messages-
        Returns:
        Typically the instance that was used to retrieve this metric.

      • getValue

        T getValue()
        Retrieve the value of this metric, which is a sum of the return values of all of this metric's MessageMeasure invocations.
        Returns:
        Whatever, depends on the measure. Initial value, before any messages arrive, is null

      • getValue

        T getValue(Message timestamp)
        Retrieve the value of this metric, which is a sum of the return values of all of this metric's MessageMeasure invocations, at the time immediately after a given message has been processed.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The point in time after this message was processed. Null will retrieve the initial state.
        Returns:
        Whatever, depends on the measure. Initial state, before any messages arrive, is MessageMeasure.initialValue(). Null is returned in case no such message was ever processed by this metric.

      • expect

        Future<Message> expect(C condition)
        Will return a future that will only return when a message arrives that makes the given condition return true.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the future to unblock.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When already #isStopped().

      • expect

        Future<Message> expect(C condition,
                     MessageAction<S> action)
        Will return a future that will only return when a message arrives that makes the given condition return true, at which point it asynchronously executes a particular action. It will not return until that action has finished executing.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the future to unblock.
        action - Action to execute when the condition becomes true.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When already #isStopped().

      • waitFor

        @Deprecated
Message waitFor(C condition)
        Deprecated. 
        Will block until a message arrives, for which the condition is true.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the method to unblock.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When already #isStopped().

      • waitFor

        @Deprecated
Message waitFor(C condition,
                         long timeout,
                         TimeUnit unit)
        Deprecated. 
        Will block until a message arrives, for which the condition is true. If none arrives before the timeout, it unblocks anyway.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the method to unblock.
        timeout - Time before forcibly aborting.
        unit - Unit of time.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When already #isStopped().
